\title{Homework 3}
\author{Antonio Zea Jr}
\maketitle
\begin{abstract}
\textbf{Description for: CS 492 Homework 3}

Public Key Cryptography

Complete the problems below and submit this word document with the
solution to the questions here.

\uline{Be sure to show your work related to each problem to receive
full credit for your answer.}
\end{abstract}

\section*{Problem 1 (similar, but not identical to book problem 4.21):}

Suppose that for the knapsack cryptosystem, the superincreasing knapsack
is $(3,5,12,23)$ with $n=47$ and $m=6$

\subsection*{What are the public and private keys?}

Private: SIK $(3,5,12,23)$ $n=47$ and $m=6$

$3\cdot6\mod47=18$

$5\cdot6\mod47=30$

$12\cdot6\mod47=25$

$23\cdot6\mod47=44$\\
Public: GK $(18,30,25,44)$

\subsection*{Encrypt the message $M=1011$ given in binary. Give your result in
decimal}

$6^{-1}\mod47$

$\begin{aligned}47=6(7)+5 & \quad\quad5=47-6(7)\\
6=5(1)+1 & \quad\quad1=6-5(1)
\end{aligned}
$$\quad\begin{aligned}1= & 6-5(1)\\
\quad1= & 6-(47-6(7))\\
1= & 6(8)-47
\end{aligned}
$$\quad\quad\therefore6^{-1}\mod47=8$

$M=1011_{2}\implies11_{10}$

$1\cdot18+0\cdot30+1\cdot25+1\cdot44=87$

\pagebreak{}

\section*{Problem 2 (similar, but not identical to book problem book 4.6):}

Suppose that Alice\textquoteright s RSA public key is $(N,e)=(33,3)$
and her private key is $d=7$.

\subsection*{If Bob encrypts the message $M=17$ using Alice's public key}

\subsubsection*{What is the ciphertext C?}

Public Key: $(N,e)=(33,3)$\\
Private Key $d=7$

$M=17$

$\begin{aligned}C= & M^{e}\mod N\\
= & 17^{3}\mod33=29
\end{aligned}
$

\subsubsection*{Show that Alice can decrypt C to obtain M}

$\begin{aligned}M= & C^{d}\mod N\\
= & 29^{7}\mod33=17
\end{aligned}
$

\subsection*{Let S be the result when Alice digitally signs the message $M=23$.}

\subsubsection*{What is $S$?}

$M=23$ and $d=7$

$S=23^{7}\mod33=23$

\subsubsection*{If Bob recieves $M$ and $S$ show how Bob verifies the signature}

$S=23$ and $(N,e)=(33,3)$

$M=23^{3}\mod33=23$

$\therefore$ Alice digitially signed this message

\pagebreak{}

\section*{Problem 3}

Alice and Bob are making a joint will (i.e. M represents the single
will for both of them). For the final will they want to send a copy
to their attorney Charlie that only Charlie can read and that shows
that both Alice and Bob have approved it. Using the notation in the
slides (same as that in the book). What would be the notation of a
message that accomplishes this task?

$\{[[M]_{\text{Bob}}]_{\text{Alice}}\}_{\text{Charlie}}$


\end{document}
